title.narrative: Improving the Capacity of Disadvantaged Farm Households in Binh Thanh Commune, Thanh Phu District of Ben Tre Province through VBHCD

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to improve the capacity of disadvantaged farm families in Binh Thanh Commune, Thanh Phu District, Ben Tre Province, in the Mekong Delta. A total of 240 selected families (120 original and 120 POG) will be divided into 10 self-help groups (SHGs). The SHGs will be trained in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, Participatory Self-Review Planning, Values-Based Holistic Community Development (VBHCD), integrated farming and micro-enterprise management. Project families will become more self-reliant, and the communities will be improved. This project will also provide trainings for the youth in the project communities. These youth will help connect the project with other youth both within and outside the communities. They will Pass on the Gift through their daily Cornerstones practice, which will inspire other youth. This project will provide heifers to 120 families. In addition to livestock, participants will receive both technical and non-technical trainings in livestock management, aquaculture, crop production, sustainable agriculture skills, enterprise development and natural resource management. Original families will also receive micro-credit funds of US$111 per family to initiate income-generating activities such as poultry raising, fish raising, cash crops and small trade. Over three years, the project will help increase the income of the participants, who will Pass on the Gift to an additional 120 families.
